wikipedia_page.main:
Sir Alfred Allen Booth, 1st Baronet (1872–1948) was a British businessman and shipowner. A scion of the Booths of Dunham Massey, Cheshire, his great-grandfather moved to Liverpool in the mid-18th century.
Booth was created a baronet in 1916 by H. H. Asquith for supporting Britain's war effort and services to industry.

response: In 1818, he married Harriet Allen; their children included attorney William Allen Butler, and Lydia Allen Butler, who married Alfred Booth and was the mother of Sir Alfred Allen Booth, 1st Baronet, a director of Alfred Booth and Company and chairman of Cunard.
*Sir Alfred Allen Booth, 1st Baronet (1872–1948), British businessman and shipowner

Born on 8 February 1907, the son of Sir Alfred Allen Booth, 1st Baronet, by his wife, Mary Blake Dwight, he attended Malvern College before going up to King's College, Cambridge where he graduated with a Bachelor of Arts degree.John Nicholls Booth, Booths in history: their roots and lives, encounters, and achievements, Bramley, Hampshire, UK: Ridgeway Press, 1982, pp. 74–75  He pursued postgraduate studies at Yale University in New Haven, Connecticut, before serving as a captain in the British Army during World War II. Upon his father's death in 1948, he succeeded to the family baronetcy.Burke's Peerage, Baronetage and Knightage, 107th edition, vol. 1, ed. Charles Mosley, Burke's Peerage Ltd, 2003, p. 427
